thread.title: Passenger and crew help deliver baby on airplane
thread.title_full: Passenger and crew help deliver baby on airplane

title: Passenger and crew help deliver baby on airplane
text:
Passenger and crew help deliver baby on airplane Last updated 08:30, October 14 2015 Your Daily News/YouTube 
Flight attendant helps deliver a premature baby when a woman goes into labour mid flight. 
A video has captured the moment a woman gave birth to her premature baby during a flight. 
The woman went into labour while on a China Airlines flight bound for Los Angeles, but the plane was forced to make an emergency landing in Alaska when her waters broke six hours into the long-haul flight, the Daily Mail has reported. 
A doctor - who happened to be on board - helped deliver the baby, thought to be around eight weeks premature. YOUTUBE/SCREENGRAB 
A woman gave birth to her baby with the help of crew and a fellow passenger on board a China Airlines flight bound for LA. 
The pilot made the decision to land the plane for the safety of the woman and her child, but 30-minutes before landing, the baby was born. 
A video, taken of the moment the baby arrived, shows airline crew wiping the baby and the mother with tissues. 
Someone can also be overheard saying: "This is a once in a lifetime thing. These tourists will never experience this again." 
The China Post has reported that the child's nationality will depend on the birth certificate issued in Alaska, because the baby was born in US airspace. 
This is the second in-flight birth in a week. 
Heba Majdy gave birth to her daughter, Nancy, on board an Jazeera Airways flight. 
According to the Daily News Egypt, the airline has since offered baby Nancy free flights until she turns 18.
